snippet: Zehy Jereis said he lavished Sandy Annabi, a former Yonkers city councilwoman, with gifts to win her love, not to buy her vote for a controversial mall and housing complex.
abstract: Zehy Jereis testifies on his own behalf in corruption trial in which both he and former Yonkers councilwoman Sandy Annabi are charged with corruption; heart of Jereis's defense is that his relationship with Annabi was largely a one-sided love story and that he was plying her with payments and gifts out of romance, and not an effort to influence her vote on a development project.
lead_paragraph: Zehy Jereis said he lavished Sandy Annabi, a former Yonkers city councilwoman, with gifts to win her love, not to buy her vote for a controversial mall and housing complex.

headline.seo: Defendant in Yonkers Corruption Case Says Gifts Were for Love, Not Politics
headline.main: Man Says Gifts to Lawmaker Were for Love
headline.print_headline: Man Says Gifts To Lawmaker Were for Love
